name: Tingting Mu
content: Tingting Mu - Research Explorer The University of Manchester Tingting Mu Dr Senior Lecturer in Machine Learning, Machine Learning and Robotics https://orcid.org/0000-0001-6315-3432 Personal profile BiographyI received my B.Eng. degree from School of the Gifted Young, University of Science and Technology of China in 2004, and Ph.D. degree from Department of Electrical Engineering and Electronics, University of Liverpool in 2008. Before I joined the Department of Computer Science, Universtiy of  Manchester in 2016, I was a lecturer in Department of Electrical Engineering and Electronics, University of Liverpool. My research is focused on developing advanced mathematical modelling and large-scale optimisation techniques to (1) simulate human intelligence and (2) analyse real-world complex data. For (1), I aim at  constructing effective machine learning models to automate tasks such as matching, recognition, prediction, ranking, inference, characterisation, language and vision understanding, etc. For (2), I aim at developing algorithms to discover latent structure and extract information from large-scale, noisy and unstructured data, e.g., text, image, video, signal, network data, supporting development of text mining systems and other related research areas such as scientific data analytics.TeachingCOMP24112 Machine Learning COMP34111 Natural Language Systems COMP24111 Machine Learning and Optimisation (2017-2020) Expertise related to UN Sustainable Development Goals In 2015, UN member states agreed to 17 global Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure prosperity for all. This person’s work contributes towards the following SDG(s): Research Beacons, Institutes and PlatformsDigital FuturesSustainable FuturesKeywordsMachine LearningComputer VisionText MiningNatural Language ProcessingScientific data analytics Fingerprint Dive into the research topics where Tingting Mu is active.
